results.title: Fire in the sea
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Views the movement of lava in the countryside and into the sea, as Kilauea, the second greatest volcanic eruption in Hawaii’s history occurs. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Choosing what to buy
results.creator_credit: Howard Potter, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and H S Potter Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation, song, puppetry and pantomime to illustrate basic economic concepts for spending money wisely. Deals with the problems of limited resources and unlimited wants, opportunity cost, and the importance of rational decision making in the market place. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Potter, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and H S Potter Productions

results.title: Choking: to save a life. - Revised edition.
results.brief_description: Describes the lifesaving procedures for clearing the airway of a choking person. Examines causes and symptons of choking and emphasizes the necessity for rapid reaction time in treating the choking victim.

results.title: The Bird who is a clown
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Introduces the island Daphne Major of the Galapagos Islands which is a small island and nesting ground for hundrreds of Blue-footed Booby birds. Emphasises the mating and upbringing of the young in order to illustrate the development of the Booby and to reveal its behaviour patterns. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Talk
results.creator_credit: Doug Wilcox, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early years at school”
Stresses the importance of talking as a medium of communication for children aged three to nine years regardless of whether or not it takes the standard middle-class form.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Children waiting
results.creator_credit: Robert Giles, Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films and National Playing Fields Association
results.brief_description: Illustrates the need for playing facilities for children who live in cities. Shows an adventure playground at Stevenage, Kent, as an example of what can be achieved through community organization and effort. Suitable for Tertiary/Teacher education.

results.title: Adventure in Venice
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.

results.title: Unity
results.creator_credit: Stephen Cross, Paul Keeler and Stephen Cross Ltd
results.brief_description: Introduces some of the ideas upon which Islamic civilization rests and serves also to ‘place’ the civilization historically and geographically. Explains the symbolic meaning of Mecca, its furnishings, and the traditional pilgrimage. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
